Remus
[4 species; Neotropical, Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental, Australian, and Oceanic Regions]

Remus Holme, 1837: 64
(species included:
sericeus
).
TYPE SPECIES
:
Remus sericeus Holme
, fixed by monotypy.

Cafius

sericeus
).

; checklist of

; type species:
sericeus

— Ciceroni and Zanetti, 1995: 27 (list of species of Italy).
— M. Hansen, 1996: 104 (cited as valid genus; list of Danish species).

Menapius Holme, 1842: 128
(species included:
sericeus
; [ Note: Nomen nudum . In a defense of his recognition of
Remus
as a genus distinct from
Cafius , Holme
mentioned that some specimens of
sericeus
had been placed in the British Museum under the name
Menapius grisescens
. Holme wrote, “I find that I was wrong in supposing

subSubSection.paragraph:
that Mr. Rudd had taken the insects which I characterized... as
Remus sericeus
, on the coast of Yorkshire; his specimens were from the Isle of Wight ,... Mr. Rudd had distinguished the specimens [from the Isle of Wight ] which he placed in the British Museum by the MS. name of
Menapius grisescens
.” Blackwelder, 1952: 237, concluded that this citation constituted validation of the generic name
Menapius
by objective synonymy with
Remus
and that the type species would be
sericeus
by monotypy. Since
Menapius
was first published as a synonym of
Remus
, it is unavailable (Article 11.6)]).

[= 1877: 430] (species included:
sericeus
,
pruinosus

filum
